reviews.comment_content:
The content by Joseph was really good and he usually made it so that every class was engaging and had a lot of discussion.

It is a morality based class, which makes it different than other business classes but keeps it very compelling for its students.

Honestly, this class makes HKUST a fun university.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Joseph is a phenomenal teacher, probably one of the best in all of HKUST. He really puts in effort in getting to know his students and is always accessible - even through email or office hours.

He makes sure to listen to everyone's points and gives great insights into his own life and what it means to actually be a business student.

Going into office hours and participating in class also makes you seem engaging to him which can also result in a higher participation score. It's all about the effort you make when you are in the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very lenient grading. He is strict in making sure you are implementing class concepts in your essays or presentation, but that is mostly to make sure you don't BS your way into getting a grade.

The class is very group based so it does make a difference who you are with because usually you don't get to choose. But once again, he is really fair and you can be honest if someone isn't carrying their weight.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is usually just participation, but also includes a final presentation and final essay. Most of this is super manageable and he does a lot of check-ins to make sure you are good in your content.

There were two role-play exercises which needed to study reading materials in order to get familiarize yourself with the topic going to be discussed. Then, you will be either assigned to a group by Mary or choose your own groupmate with a specific stakeholders and discuss the instructions. For the first role-play exercise, I was one of them to represent the group to express our opinions though I said something incorrect and luckily my groupmates reminded me.
